title: ESPN.com website keeps redirecting to it's foreign sites
content:
Hello,

I have the site espn.com bookmarked and for the last month or so it has been opening it's various foreign sites instead of the united states version when I click on the bookmark tab. It will switch to the UK and Mexico sites randomly when I click on the tab. The address is saved as the US version (espn.com) when this happens so I can't figure out why it's doing it. It doesn't matter if I use a vpn that says I'm in the US or just my regular internet provider in the US, the site keeps changing what country it chooses to open with. I noticed that every time I click the tab it will cycle between the various different sites for each country even though as I said before, the bookmark is set for espn.com. It makes no sense as none of my other bookmarks do this and it doesn't do it when I use Safari's browser. Is there anything on my end I can do to get this to stop or is it coming from espn.com's end? Thank you for your time and help.Â :)
creator: mtnrydr

title: Crashing after closing a live stream tab
content:
For some unknown reason, whenever I close a live stream tab, whether it's Twitch or Youtube Live, my browser will freeze for a couple of minutes before returning to normal. Also, it doesn't happen if I opened a stream but closed it after a few minutes of watching but if I watched the stream for an extended period of time then it will almost always crash.

Anyone else have this weird issue? Any help would be appreciated thank you.
creator: mr.chiu.simon

title: when mousing over tabs and the menu bar on MacOS the browser gets a weird padding
content: You can tell me if this is an issue with the software or some of my settings. If it's an issue with my settings then please tell me how I can fix it.
creator: tin.sucevic

title: How to stop popup video boxes?
content:
When I search for autoplay in about:config I get quite a few matches and have disabled all of them (I think). Yet video boxes/windows still popup blocking part of the page. Is there any way of stopping them? At least now the sound has been muted. But when I checked permissions for a particularly aggravating website I see that in Permissions I see autoplay is allowed/default. It seems Firefox is intent on disrupting my reading by these incessant and pestering videos, 99% of which are utter drivel and have nothing to do with what I'm trying to read. Its like web design by 8 year old children.

What is the solution for killing video popups once and for all? As videos often don't even work in Firefox I've relegated video watching to Chrome which is fine. I use Firefox for reading and Chrome for watching. No problem.
creator: moz2u

title: Syncing using qr code on PC
content: I've lost the password to my Firefox account, which hasn't been a problem moving onto new mobile devices since I can just use the QR code generated by my PC browser to Sync. But now I have a new laptop and I've downloaded extensions/apps to read those same QR codes from the new laptop's webcam, but Firefox is still prompting me to put in a password. Is there a way around this or am I going to have to reset my password and lose all my encrypted data? Thanks for the help.
creator: npotvin
